work.name: CPSC 525/625: Principles of Computer Security, University of Calgary
highlights: Assisted Dr. Ryan Henry with teaching and creating worksheets.
Supported students in identifying and exploiting vulnerabilities in C programs, while grading assignments, blog posts and worksheets throughout the course.

work.name: CPSC 525/625: Principles of Computer Security, University of Calgary
highlights: Assisted Dr. Ryan Henry with teaching and creating worksheets.
Supported students in identifying and exploiting vulnerabilities in C programs, while grading assignments, blog posts and worksheets throughout the course.

work.name: CPSC 411: Compiler Construction, University of Calgary
highlights: Assisted Prof. John Aycock with teaching and conducted tutorials.
Taught students how to use Flex & Bison to create a lexical analyzer and parser and showed them how to build abstract syntax trees in C, C++, and Java.
Helped students in building parsing tables and understand different parsing algorithms.
Supported students in implementing and debugging a compiler, offering example code, and grading assignments throughout the process.

work.name: CPSC 411: Compiler Construction, University of Calgary
highlights: Assisted Prof. John Aycock with teaching and conducted tutorials.
Taught students how to use Flex & Bison to create a lexical analyzer and parser and showed them how to build abstract syntax trees in C, C++, Java and Go.
Helped students in building parsing tables and understand different parsing algorithms.
Supported students in implementing and debugging a compiler, offering example code, and grading assignments throughout the process.
Nominated for Teaching Excellence Award based on student feedback.
